name: Outer Limits
description: The strange phenomena have not ended with the Le Guin. Other ships arriving in the present are experiencing their own phenomena. Could this situation offer any hints on the future of the anomaly crisis itself?
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Ship Battles in one Phase, and Federation, Ferengi Alliance or Maquis Faction Missions in another Phase.
-- Unique Ship Battles and Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Doctor Kovich, any version of Detmer, Pollard, Linus or Discovery Crew will provide a bonus to Ship Battles and Faction Missions.
-- Using the U.S.S. Hiawatha, the U.S.S. Vancouver, or the Nova Class Ship will provide a hull bonus in Skirmish Battles.
-- Every Ship Battle or Faction Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Doctor Kovich, Detmer, Pollard, Linus or Discovery Crew
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: J'Vini
featured_crew.flavor: For a Qalankhkai, an oath is an unbreakable promise until it is fulfilled. Not even Starfleet officers can stop J'Vini in her mission.

action.name: Come After Me And Your Lives Are Forfeit

featured_crew.name: Pollard
featured_crew.flavor: After traveling to the 32nd century with the rest of the U.S.S. Discovery crew, Dr. Pollard continues her mission to save lives.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Janitor
rewards.flavor: An officer aboard the U.S.S Cabot was given the unfortunate task of cleaning up Larkin’s modified Tribbles.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Nova Class
ship.flavor: Designed for short-term missions of science and exploration. Features advanced sensor arrays.

ship.flavor: A 23rd century medical frigate that was lost during the Federation-Klingon War.

ship.flavor: A Parliament-class engineering ship shouldered with a surprising amount of epic missions. Too many, according to one crew member.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: J'Vini
rewards.flavor: For a Qalankhkai, an oath is an unbreakable promise until it is fulfilled. Not even Starfleet officers can stop J'Vini in her mission.

action.name: Come After Me And Your Lives Are Forfeit

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "It seems I've allowed my fascination with the questions surrounding the Le Guin to give me tunnel vision. The Le Guin was far from the only vessel experiencing strange phenomena. I've begun collecting further data on the topic, but..."

"...but we still actually need someone to bring these ships in to investigate them. And some of the phenomena have expanded past just the ships from the far future. Could something be spreading from them, like some sort of infection?"
"Yes, tunnel vision is definitely an issue of yours, Doctor. You can 'acquire data' later. Let's triage this situation and actually bring in the ships causing all of this chaos."
